title: NASA's Big Moon Trip: When and Who?
summary: NASA is planning a big space mission called Artemis II to go to the Moon. It might launch in February 2024 and last about 10 days. This is the first time in over 50 years that people will fly to the Moon. The mission has four astronauts: Reid Wiseman, Victor Glover, Christina Koch, and Jeremy Hansen. They will fly in a rocket from Florida and test a new spacecraft called Orion. The astronauts will practice flying, check systems, and send back data from space. After their trip, they will splash down in the Pacific Ocean. This mission helps prepare for future Moon landings.

options: Splash down in the Pacific Ocean
questions.correct_answer: Splash down in the Pacific Ocean

background_read: NASA is a space agency that sends rockets and astronauts to explore space. The Moon is Earth's closest neighbor in space, and people first landed there in 1969. Artemis II is part of a new program to return humans to the Moon and learn more about space travel.
Article_Structure: WHO: NASA astronauts Reid Wiseman, Victor Glover, Christina Koch, and Jeremy Hansen
WHAT: A crewed mission to test the Orion spacecraft and prepare for Moon landings
WHERE: Launches from Kennedy Space Center in Florida and splashes down in the Pacific Ocean
WHY: To practice space travel and get ready for future missions to the Moon

perspectives.description: This mission helps humans learn more about space and prepare for living on the Moon someday
